column3:
I don't think we should be adding any new IP finding services.

I'd rather remove the malfunctioning service (#4682), and use this as an oppertunity to resurrect #3461 / #3088.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4686_f175a0da56b78d86255520fb0862627f7a50cb4a/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

Fair enough.. I'll just say that I run the whatismyasn.org site and am committed to keeping it running on that IP.. might be an ok temporary solution until peer based IP detection is working.. but no worries if you don't want it.\n
Removing the lookup altogether seems a far better alternative. The external IP lookup is even more intrusive than the DNS seeds for which we started mandating certain logging policies.\n
@cdecker If you want to help testing see https://github.com/gmaxwell/bitcoin/commits/extip3 .\n
@laanwj saw the branch on IRC and I'd like to test it. Currently I can only provide code review since I don't have access to a machine where I can run bitcoind from.\n
Closing this as we want to phase out usage of these kinds of services.\n
